amendment.description: Redesignate section 5 as section 6 and insert after section 4 the following: SEC. 5. CONGRESSIONAL ACCEPTANCE OF SCIENTIFIC FINDINGS. Congress accepts the scientific finding (contained in the proposed rule referred to in section 4(2)) that greenhouse gas pollution is "contributing to long-lasting changes in our climate that can have a range of negative effects".
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 6 printed in House Report 113-373 to accept the scientific finding of the EPA that greenhouse gas pollution is "contributing to long-lasting changes in our climate that can have a range of negative effects".

vote.text: On agreeing to the Schakowsky amendment (A006) Failed by recorded vote: 190 - 221 (Roll no. 103).

action.text: Amendment failed in Committee of the Whole
Roll call votes on amendments in House
House amendment not agreed to: On agreeing to the Schakowsky amendment (A006) Failed by recorded vote: 190 - 221 (Roll no. 103).
House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A006) offered by Ms. Schakowsky.
